definitions.body: with foll. gen. (as usually) the whole of, to be rendered, however, often in our idiom, to avoid stiffness, all or every:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: Ge 2:2 [[כָּל־חְבָאָם]] the whole of their host, v:Ge 2:13 [[כָּל־אֶרֶץ כּוּשׁ]] the whole of the land of Kush; [[כָּל־הַלַּיְלָה]] the whole of the night; [[כָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל]] the whole of Israel = all Israel; De 4:29 [[בְּכָל־לְבָֽבְְ]] with the whole of thy heart = with all thy heart; + very oft. With a plural noun, usu. determined by the art. or a genitive: Ge 5:5 [[כל־ימי אדם]] the whole of (= all) the days of Adam, Ge 37:35 [[כל־בניו]] the whole of (= all) his sons, Is 2:2 [[כל־הגוים]] all the nations; Ge 43:9 + oft. [[כל הימים]] = continually. In poetry, however, the noun may remain undetermined, [[כָּל־יׇדַיִם]] the whole of hands = every hand, Is 13:7, Je 48:37, Ez Eze 21:12; [[כל־פנים]] i.e. every face Is 25:8, Joe 2:6; [[כל שׁלחנות]] Is 28:8; [[כל חוחות]] Is 51:20, La 2:19 al. Before an inf. † Ge 30:41, De 4:7, 1Ki 8:52, 1Ch 23:31. Freq. with sfs., as [[כֻּלּוֹ]] ([[כֻּלּֽה]]) the whole of him Ge 25:25, Job 21:23, Ct So 5:16, the whole of it Le 13:13, Je 2:21, Na 2:1, Pr 24:31; [[כֻּלָּהּ]] the whole of it Ge 13:10, Ex 19:18, Ex 25:36, Am 8:8; [[כֻּלָּךְ]] all of thee Ct So 4:7 + (v. ad init.); [[כֻּלָּנוּ]] the whole of us Ge 42:11, De 5:3, Is 53:6, Is 53:6; [[כֻּלְּכֶם]] De 1:22, De 4:4, 1Sa 22:7, 1Sa 22:7; [[כֻּלָּם]] Ge 11:6, Ge 43:34, Jos 8:24 [[ויפלו כֻּלָּם]], Ju Jdg 11:6 [[בְּיַד כֻּלָּם]], Is 7:19, Is 31:3 + oft.—Twice, strangely, with hyperb. intensive force, Ps 39:6 [[כָּל־הֶבֶל]] the whole of vanity are all men (? om. [[כל]], as v:Ps 39:12), Ps 45:14 [[כָּל־כְּבוּדָּה]] the whole of gloriousness is the king's daughter.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: followed often by a singular, to be understood collectively, whether with or without the art.: Ge 1:21 [[את כל נפשׁ החיה]] the whole of living souls = every living soul, Ge 2:9 [[כל עץ נחמד למראה]] the whole of trees (every kind of tree) pleasant to view, Ge 6:12 + [[כָּל־בָּשָׂר]], Ge 7:14 [[כל]] [[חפור כל כנף]] all birds of every kind of wing (so Ez Eze 17:23), v:Eze 17:21 [[כל האדם]] the whole of mankind (so Nu 12:3, Nu 16:29, Ju Jdg 16:17 al.); poet. [[כל־אדם]] Ps 39:6, Ps 64:10 +; 1Sa 14:52 [[כל אישׁ גבור וכל־בן־חיל]], 1Sa 17:19, 1Sa 17:24 [[כל אישׁ ישׂראל]], 1Sa 22:2; Is 9:16 [[כל פה]] the whole of mouths = every mouth, Is 15:2, Is 24:10 [[כָּל־בַּיִת]] + oft. (in Is 2:12–16 the sg. and pl. interchange); Ps 7:12 + [[בכל־יום]], Ps 10:5 + [[בכל־עת]] = at all seasons. So [[כל־העץ]] Ge 1:29, [[כל־הבן]] Ex 1:22 = all the sons, [[כל־המקום]] Ex 20:24, De 11:24 = all the places, [[כל־המרכב]] Le 15:9, v:Le 15:26, De 4:3 [[כל־האישׁ אשׁר]] = all the men who… , De 15:19 [[כל־הבכור]], Je 4:29 [[כל־העיר עזובה]] all the cities (notice the foll. [[בָּהֶן]]); [[כל־היום]] = all the days (v. [[יוֹם]]

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: the gen. after [[כל]] is oft. a rel. sentence, introduced by [[אשׁר]]: Ge 1:31 [[את כל אשׁר עשׂה]] the whole of what he had made, Ge 7:22, Ge 13:1 + very oft. Sts., with a prep., [[כל אשׁר]] has the force of wheresover, whithersoever, as Jos 1:7 [[בְּכׂל אֲשֶׁר תֵּלֵךְ]] wheresoever thou goest, v:Jos 1:16 [[אֶל־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר]] whithersoever (see [[אֲשֶׁר]]

definitions.title: 4 b

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: with a suffix two idiomatic uses of [[כל]] have to be noticed: (a) [[כל]] is often made more independent and emphatic by being placed with a suffix after the word which it qualifies, to which it then stands in apposition (cf. in Syr., Ar., Eth.), as 2Sa 2:9 [[יִשְׂרָאֵל כֻּלּהׂ]], Je 13:19, Je 48:31, Is 9:8, Is 14:29, Is 14:31 [[פלשׁת]] [[כלך]] Philistia, all of thee ! Mic 2:12, Hb Hab 2:6, Job 34:13, Ps 67:4, Ps 67:6; esp. in Ezek., as Eze 14:5, Eze 29:2 [[מחרים כֻּלָּהּ]] Eze 32:12, Eze 32:30; with change of person (cf. the idiom in Is 22:16, Is 48:1, Is 54:1 etc.), 1Ki 22:28 = Mic 1:2 [[שׁמעו עמים]] [[כלם]] Hear, nations, all of them ! Mal 3:9 [[הַגּוֹי כֻּלּוֹ]]. So even with [[כל]] preceding: Nu 16:3 [[כָּל־הָעֵדָה כֻּלָּם]], Is 14:18, Je 30:16, Ez Eze 11:15 [[כל בית ישׂראל כֻּלּֽה]] the whole of the house of Israel, the whole of it (so Eze 20:40, Eze 36:10), Eze 35:15, Eze 36:5, Ps 8:8 (cf. Sab. DHM:l. c.); (b) with the sf. of 3 ms., understood as referring to the mass of things or persons meant, [[כֻּלּֽה]] or [[כֻּלּוֹ]], lit. the whole of it, is equivalent to all of them, every one, † Ex 14:7 and captains [[עַל־כֻּלּוֹ]] upon the whole of it (the [[רֶכֶב]] collectively) = all of them, Is 1:23 the whole of it (the people) loveth bribes, Is 9:16, Is 15:3, Je 6:13, Je 6:13, Je 8:6, Je 8:10, Je 8:10, Je 20:7, Hab 1:9, Hab 1:15, Ps 29:9 and in his temple [[כֻּלּוֹ אׂמֵר כָּבוֹד]] the whole of it (= every one there) says, Glory ! Ps 53:4 (‖ Ps 14:3 [[הַכּׂל]]); perh. Is 16:7, Je 48:38; + Pr 19:6 Ew Hi ([[וְכֻלּהׂ רֵעַ]]): Je 15:10 rd. [[כֻּלְּהֶם קִלֲלוּנִי]].

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: Heb. idiom in certain cases affirms, or denies, of an entire class, where Engl. idiom affirms, or denies, of an individual of the class; thus in a compar. or hypoth. sentence [[כל]] is = any, and with a neg. = none: (a) Ge 3:1 the serpent was more subtil [[מכל חית השׂדה]] than all beasts of the field (in our idiom: than any beast of the field), De 7:7, 1Sa 9:2; (b) Le 4:2 a soul when it sins through ignorance [[י]]“[[מכל מחות י]] in all the commandments of Jehovah (= in any of the commandments, etc.), Le 19:23 when ye…plant [[כל־עץ מאכל]] = any tree for food, Nu 35:22 or if he have cast upon him [[כָּל־כְּלִי]] = any weapon, 1Ki 8:37 b; joined with a ptcp. in a hypoth. sense (Dr:§ 121 n. Ges:§ 116. 5 R. 5), Ge 4:14 [[כל מחאי]] all my finders (= if any one find me), he will slay me, v:Ge 4:15 a, Nu 21:8 [[כָּל־הַנׇּשׁוּךְ]] = whosoever (= if any one) is bitten, 1Sa 2:13; (c) with a neg., Ge 2:5 all plants of the field [[טֶרֶם יִהְיֶה]] were not as yet = no plant of the field as yet was, Ge 4:15 b [[לבלתי הכות־אתו כל־מחאו]] for the not-smiting him of all finding him = that none finding him should smite him, Ex 10:15 [[ולא־נותר כל ירק]] = and no green things were left, Ex 12:16 [[כל־מלאכה לא יעשׂה]] all work shall not be done = no work shall be done, De 28:14, Ju Jdg 13:4 [[אַל־תּאׁכְלִי כָּל־טָמֵא]] eat not of all that is unclean, Jdg 19:19 [[אֵין מַחְסוֹר כָּל־דָּבָר]] there is no lack of all things i.e. of any thing, Ps 143:2 [[כי לא־יחדק לפניך]] [[כל־חי]], + very oft. (so ou) pa=v, as a Hebraism, in the N. definitions.title: 2 b
definitions.body: a) [[הַכּׂל]] is emph. (In Nu 23:13 [[וְכֻלּוֹ לאׁ תִרְאֶה]] the context shews that [[כּׂל]] is opp. to a part).

definitions.title: f.
definitions.body: very anomalously, severed from its gen., † 2Sa 1:9 [[כִּי־כָל־עוֹד]] [[נַפְשִׁי בִי]], Job 27:3 [[כִּי־כָל־עוֹד נִשְׁמָתִי בִי]], Ho 14:3 (si vera l.) [[כָּל־תִּשָּׂא עָוֹן]]. On Ec 5:15 ´[[כָּל־עֻמַּת־שֶׂ]] v. [[עֻמָּה]].

definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: Note.—When the gen. after [[כל]] is a noun fem. or pl., the pred. usu. agrees with this (as being the really important idea), e.g. Ge 5:5 [[ויהיו כל ימי אדם]], Nu 14:1 [[וַתִּשָּׂא כָל־הָעֵדָה]], Na 3:1, Ps 150:6 [[כָּׂל הַנְּשָׁמָה תְּהַלֵּל]] exceptions being very rare, Is 64:10 b, Pr 16:2 (Ges:§ 141. 1 R. 2).
